Text: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings
Author: Socrates

Text: In the country of the blind the one eyed man is king
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
Author: Chinese proverb

Text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Text: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
Author: Confucius

Text: You are guaranteed zero failures if you never try, but you're also guaranteed zero successes
Author: Sean McCabe

Text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
Author: Epictetus

Text: The summit of happiness is reached when a person is ready to be what he is.
Author: Desiderius Erasmus

Text: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
Author: Aristotle

Text: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
Author: Confucius

Text: All models are wrong, some are useful.
Author: George Box

Text: Much learning does not teach understanding.
Author: Heraclitus

Text: Without music, life would be a mistake
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Text: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
Author: John Johnson

Text: The best solution to a problem is not to have it
Author: Michal Migurski

Text: What people think of you is none of your business.
Author: Amy Hatvany

Text: Beauty awakens the soul to act
Author: Dante

Text: Few people can be happy unless they hate some other person, nation or creed
Author: Bertrand Russell

Text: I would not give a fig for the simplicity this side of complexity, but I would give my life for the simplicity on the other side of complexity
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

Text: All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
Author: Leo Tolstoy

Text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
Author: Abelson, Sussman, et. al.

Text: If we offend, it is with our good will that you should think, we come not to offend, but with good will. To show our simple skill, that is the true beginning of our end.
Author: William Shakespeare

Text: It's just a job. Grass grows, birds fly, waves pound the sand. I beat people up.
Author: Muhammad Ali

Text: Virtue is more to be feared than vice, because its excesses are not subject to the regulation of conscience
Author: Adam Smith

Text: On the road from the city of skepticism I had to pass through the valley of ambiguity.
Author: Adam Smith

Text: When it becomes serious, you have to lie
Author: Jean-Claude Juncker

Text: Before the Roman came to Rye or out to Severn strode, the rolling English drunkard made the rolling English road.
Author: GK Chesterton

Text: It is fitting that a liar should be a man of good memory
Author: Maurcus Fabius Quintilian

Text: Do. Or do not. There is no try.
Author: Master Yoda

Text: Never attribute to malice that which is adequately explained by stupidity,
Author: Hanlon's razor

Text: This is a good death. There’s no shame in this. In a man’s death, a man who has done fine works.
Author: The Operative

Text: So convenient a thing is it to be a reasonable creature, since it enables one to find or make a reason for everything one had in mind to do.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Text: Unfortunately, in human relations, people seek to assign blame and avoid responsibility. But in reality, there is no blame, only responsibility.
Author: Master Bho Li

Text: Software is eating the world
Author: Marc Andreesen

Text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be
Author: William Shakespeare

Text: You are terminated
Author: The Terminator

Text: You're fired!
Author: The Apprentice

Text: Resistance is futile
Author: The Borg

Text: Qapla'
Author: Klingon phrase

Text: Live long and prosper
Author: Vulcan phrase

Text: Go forth and multiply
Author: Genesis 1:21,28; 9:1 (paraphrased)

Text: Rosebud
Author: Citizen Kane

Text: Today is a good day to die
Author: Klingon phrase

Text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere
Author: Albert Einstein

Text: Everybody's got a plan. Then they get hit.
Author: Mike Tyson

Text: Though this be madness, yet there is method in't.
Author: William Shakespeare
Source: The tragedy of Hamlet, Prince of Denmark

Text: That will prove awful both in deed and word.
Author: William Shakespeare

Text: And, I pray thee now, tell me for which of my bad parts didst thou first fall in love with me?
Author: William Shakespeare

Text: The good or ill of man lies within his own will
Author: Epictetus

Text: I do not enlighten those who are not eager to learn, nor arouse those who are not anxious to give an explanation themselves. If I have presented one corner of the square and they cannot come back to me with the other three, I should not go over the points again
Author: Confucius

Text: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.
Author: Robert Burns

Text: But to see her was to love her, love but her, and love forever.
Author: Robert Burns

Text: I am little acquainted with politeness, but I know a good deal of benevolence of temper and goodness of heart.
Author: Robert Burns

Text: Do not go gentle into that good night
Author: Dylan Thomas

Text: Do all the good you can, by all the means you can, in all the ways you can, in all the places you can, at all the times you can, to all the people you can, as long as ever you can.
Author: John Wesley

Text: The more they overthink the plumbing, the easier it is to stop up the drain.
Author: Scotty

Text: Your representative owes you, not his industry only, but his judgment; and he betrays, instead of serving you, if he sacrifices it to your opinion.
Author: Edmund Burke

Text: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.
Author: Cicero

Text: He who does not understand your silence will probably not understand your workds
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Text: The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, But in ourselves, that we are underlings.
Author: Cassius
